intro: Hemionitis albomarginata, commonly known as the white-margin fern, is a rare and delicate plant native to the mountainous regions of China. It is characterized by its slender, arching fronds with a distinctive white margin along the edges of the leaves. The plant belongs to the family Hemionitidaceae and is known for its unique morphology and limited distribution. It thrives in cool, moist environments, often found in shaded, rocky habitats. Due to its rarity and specific ecological requirements, Hemionitis albomarginata is considered a conservation concern.
